attributes.action: Switch to the Renewable Plan B for Hinkley C – fit for the 21st Century
attributes.background:
Theresa May's Government is reviewing the Hinkley C nuclear reactor project

This expensive white elephant would hand the keys of Britain's future energy security to the Chinese and French Governments, while blocking investment and grid access for faster and cheaper renewable energy alternatives
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, Molly Scott Cato MEP published 'The Power to Transform the South West', showing that SW England can provide 100% of its future energy needs solely from renewable energy resources.

In February, Lawrence Slade, Chief Executive of ‘Big Six’ industry body Energy UK joined in – calling for a German-style Energiewende energy transition.

Now is the time to switch to a renewable energy future of ever-cheaper wind, solar, tidal lagoon and biomass power – creating many more jobs than Hinkley C.

attributes.action: Brexit should NOT include free movement of people or contributions to EU funds.
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU and should not pay into it. They need to trade with us more than we need them.

attributes.action: Dementia carers give them the recognition and specialist  title they deserve.
attributes.background: It is a requirement for all staff working within dementia to have specialised training and qualifications so I feel they should be recognised for their hard work, passion and dedication in providing high standard of care for people suffering with dementia by making it a specialised career choice
attributes.additional_details: Being a manager of a dementia care home I hear a lot of staff and others refer to the carers as ONLY A CARER I feel this is degrading and demoralising. Their are a lot of good passionate caring carers out there that are not being recognised for this only recognition is bad recognition.Dementia is becoming more progressive and affecting the younger people as well as the elderly. More and more people may be affected by this condition due to people living longer, better awareness and research

attributes.action: Make election manifestos a legal and binding contractual document
attributes.background: The voter bases their decision on who to vote for in local & general elections, on their promises made within election manifestos. We seek a law BEFORE the 2020 election, the make these manifestos, legally binding documents which must be adhered to within 12 months of election, or face prosecution
attributes.additional_details: If any government is voted in and does not fulfill their manifesto promises without good and legal reason within their first 12 months in office, they shall face prosecution under fraud law, and must immediately dissolve their government.

attributes.action: Free feminine sanitary products for all women.
attributes.background: Reports that women are using old socks as sanitary towels because they cannot afford to buy products. This could lead to serious infections and is not a situation to be tolerated in a civilised country.
attributes.additional_details:
Women do not choose to have periods. They occur as part of nature of being a woman. A period is something to be celebrated as an affirmation of the continuity of life and hope for the future.
With this in mind and to confirm the importance of women to society as the bearers of the human race amongst other things, I propose that feminine sanitary products are made available free of charge to all women through their doctors surgery.

attributes.action: Give Liverpool City Council the right to ban racist marches in Liverpool
attributes.background:
Liverpool is a city with a diverse community.  It is something 'Scousers' are proud of and want to uphold. 
The people of Liverpool have shown time and again that right wing extremists are not welcome here. Please give our City Council the power to act on behalf of it's people and ban such marches.

attributes.action: Stop recording laws on vellum
attributes.background: Recording laws on the skin of a young murdered animal is not only unnecessary & unethical, it is also expensive. Ending this practise of writing on dried baby skin could save at least £80,000 a year yet is continued for tradition. We request a move to archive paper, or digital recording.

attributes.action: Class babies that have passed from 12 weeks on as stillbirth not miscarriage!
attributes.background: My daughter passed at 16 weeks gestation and i delivered her naturally at 20 weeks. She was perfect in everyway. Toes fingers everything all perfectly formed. She just wasnt alive. Shes down 'officially' as a miscarriage and i think the law on this needs changed!!
attributes.additional_details: Unfortunately a lot of babies who have passed before 24 weeks and are 'categorized' as a miscarriage. This itself is a miscarriage of justice. Our children were here, we held them, we talked to them. They may have been born sleeping but they were still born!!

attributes.action: Stop private companies offering NHS services from using the NHS logo.
attributes.background:
Private companies such as Serco, Circle, Virgin and others deliver NHS services using the NHS name and logo.

The public does not want the NHS privatised and most people have no idea that they are being treated by the private sector.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS logo is a tried and trusted brand. If private companies give poor care while operating under the NHS brand, the NHS is likely to get the blame

It is important that users of healthcare services know who is providing the care they are getting.

attributes.action: Retractions of misleading media should be the same prominence as the original
attributes.background:
Highlighted by the Sun's front page article on Muslims support for Jihadi fighters. A retraction was ordered as the survey used was deliberately misleading, it was 'hidden' in a boring column of text titled 'Ispo ruling upheld'

Retractions should be equal prominence to original.
attributes.additional_details:
People have a right to know when they have been mislead, and clearly the majority who read the headline article will not have read the retraction.

Deliberately obscure retraction: https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CedPBYBWQAAtDs1.jpg

Original headline: https://vice-images.vice.com/images/articles/meta/2015/11/24/i-conducted-the-muslim-poll-the-sun-jihadi-sympathy-1448380391.png

attributes.action: Link the subsidiary lights on the sides of long vehicles to the signal lights.
attributes.background: Long vehicles play a disproportionate part in injuries to cyclists. Linking the subsidiary lights already along the length of long vehicles to its signalling system would give cyclists vital seconds warning to take avoiding action, so help save their own lives instead of having to rely on drivers.
attributes.additional_details: All attempts to reduce cyclists injuries revolve around driver awareness - new cab design etc - nothing is done to improve cyclists' awareness. Often the first time cyclists realise they are in danger is when a vehicle hits them. Most drivers signal long before they turn however the signal lights are often out of the cyclists' field of view or they are distracted by hazards such as pedestrians and poor road surfaces. The line of shoulder level lights would attract the cyclists' attention.

attributes.action: We demand the governmnet withdraw the UK's involvement with the Syrian conflict.
attributes.background: Given recent events with Cameron mislaeding the Syrian war vote by not informing us that some of the 70,000 Syrian troops he said would do the groundwork are extremists and a leaked UN report showing our involvement in targeting civilians in Yemen by weapon sales and intel, we are breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details: Just tag me for proof!

attributes.action: To consider protecting CC41&11011 the historic symbols under IPO article 6_ter
attributes.background: I would like you to consider protecting the historic expired marks CC41 and 11011 under article 6_ter or equivalent Non EU regulation so that it remains free to use by the people and not that of sole property of an individual so that they are able to gain financial reward.
attributes.additional_details: It recently came to my attention that an individual has successfully published the iconic CC41, I intend to fully challange the Mark personally and have appealed and invited the millions of Brits to join me in this campaign,  so that the trademark CC41 is not granted solely to the individual Mr Douglas Steward, further information of this can be found on the IPO website under the words "CC41" The double 11s symbol 11011, another iconic symbol I also wish you to consider protecting.

attributes.action: Prevent the UK government from introducing new licensing laws for air guns.
attributes.background:
Airguns already require licences when they are above a certain power yet new laws have been proposed to apply license requirements for ALL air guns. 

Airguns are important for pest and vermin control and are a fun hobby for many people across the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
There were 4,203 recorded crimes in which air weapons were used during 2010/11, a fall of 15% compared with the previous year and 70% below the peak recorded in 2002/03.

In England and Wales firearms were reportedly used in 11,227 offences, 0.3% of all recorded crimes.

In England and Wales there were 388 firearm offences in which there was a fatal or serious injury, 13% lower than in 2009/10. In almost 80% of firearms offences no injury occurred.

www.parliament.uk/briefing-papers/sn01940.pdf

attributes.action: Ban the use of Audible bird scarers
attributes.background: Ban the total use of bird scarers "gas cannon". These cannons are affecting the use and enjoyment of our homes and there is absolutely no legislation for something that affectively is a FIREARM. Our government needs to outright ban on them or closely legislate it

attributes.action: Reverse the Chancellor's decision on the Housing Benefit Cap
attributes.background: Elderly people living in Extra Care Housing Schemes will not get enough housing benefit to cover their rent and service charges.  If they take up new tenancies, especially if they move to a new development the Government proposes to cap their housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
National Housing Federation
BBC
Local newspaper coverage
Local authorities
Other housing providers

attributes.action: All healthcare staff to be trained on treating those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: My husband suffers with PTSD and some mental health issues. Since his diagnosis we have struggled to get him the help he needs. This has been exasperated by GPs, their staff and other healthcare providers being unprofessional, unsympathetic or even understanding of their patient.
attributes.additional_details:
In my capacity with support groups and organisations, I have heard various similar experiences. Patients being told that because they aren't suicidal that minute, they can't be seen because staff are too "busy", patients being refused medication, being told they don't have the "correct" symptoms, being told they are "making it up". 
If the people you are supposed to turn to when we need help the most don't treat us with dignity and respect, what hope is there?

attributes.action: Respond specifically to petition questions or issues
attributes.background:
A large number of petitions are met with government responses that intentionally do not address the topic or issue presented.

This tactic is frustrating and demonstrates contempt for signatories.
attributes.additional_details:
For example, in a recent petition calling for a debate between Jeremy hunt and junior doctors, the civil servants drafting the response fail to mention the very point of the petition - a debate between Hunt and doctors.

Instead we receive paragraph after paragraph of obfuscation and avoidance.

attributes.action: Make university free for all people.
attributes.background: All people should have the right to higher education, without having to worry about how they will pay off the £9000 per year (which is set to rise in 2017/18). This is wrong, because some people, of poorer backgrounds, will struggle to pay and therefore be put off university.

attributes.action: We call on the Government to hold a Referendum to Reform the House of Lords ,
attributes.background: There are 826 Members of the House of Lords the average daily attendance is around 483, the net operating costs for the chamber totalled 94.4 million four 2014/2015, of this 20.7 million was spent on members allowances and expenses. Surely this should be put to a referendum of the people.
attributes.additional_details: if they can certify that they have carried out appropriate Parliamentary work in Westminster they are entitled to claim a tax-free daily allowance of £300, also they can choose to claim a lower rate of £150 tax-free for work away from Westminster. We call on the Government to hold a Referendum to Reform the House of Lords by having a Second Chamber Elected from the Nations and Regions throughout the UK,

attributes.action: RAF Mildenhall as an alternative Dragracing track
attributes.background: The United States Air Force pulls out of RAF Mildenhall in 2022. Mildenhall airport is fully operational and could easily be reused as a motorsport venue.

attributes.action: Reduce the fees for citizenship application for EU nationals
attributes.background: In response to the latest "Brexit"referendum results, we the undersigned call upon HM Government, to reduce the fees for citizenship application for EU nationals who have been living and working in the UK for over 6 years
attributes.additional_details:
Currently to apply for British Naturalisation we have to pay £1,236.00
plus other expenses for the  "met the knowledge of English" and "life in the UK" tests

attributes.action: Appoint a youth representative to negotiations on exiting the European Union.
attributes.background: Acknowledging the evidence that 75% of young people (18-25) voted to remain in the EU referendum, we call on the government to include a youth representative in the negotiations on Britain's exit from the EU to speak for young people and their future in Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
The polls up to and following the referendum showed young people overwhelmingly in favour of Europe, one of the largest of these shows that 18-25 year olds clearly voted to remain: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/

Recognising that this affects the future of our country and our long term economic stability, we ask that young people get a voice in shaping this future.

attributes.action: The UK must not leave the European Economic Area (EEA) without a referendum
attributes.background: The UK voted in a referendum on 23rd June 2016 to leave the European Union. No referendum has been held on whether the UK should leave the European Economic Area (EEA). Therefore we, the undersigned, ask HM Government to legislate that the United Kingdom cannot leave the EEA without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The European Economic Area (EEA) comprises all 28 EU member states plus Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. Membership of the EU and EEA is separate, as evidenced by Croatia's joining of the EU on 1st July 2013 and its delayed provisional joining of the EEA on 12th April 2014. Most rights enjoyed by citizens of EU countries apply equally to citizens of EEA countries, most notably the free movement of people. If the UK leaves the EU without leaving the EEA, it will be similar to Norway or Iceland.

attributes.action: Allow European residents living in UK to vote if there's another EU referendum
attributes.background: I am a Spanish resident living in London since 2000, working in the NHS and paying my taxes in this country. I believe is very unfair that the EU citizens did not have the opportunity to vote if we want to be out or in from the EU. My request is to give us a voice as we are tax payers supporting UK

attributes.action: STOP fining parents & providing evidence of ill children who miss days of school
attributes.background: My child has missed many days of school due to Asthma. He has regular flare ups and suffers with coughing fits/ weasiness & breathlessness as a result also causing lack of sleep and the need to stay at home. We are facing a court proceedings because of his low school attendance percentage.
attributes.additional_details: We have had to provide /medical evidence' and letters of consent from a doctor to say he is unfit for school. This is discriminating against a parents' verbal word, making us feel like liars when our child is poorly. This takes up valuable doctors appointments, when our children are not always needed to be seen by a doctor. Other bugs fly around schools where we should also keep our children at home but not see a doctor. STOP PROSECUTING PARENTS for educational statistical targets!

attributes.action: Stop providing security for Tony Blair's Overseas commitments
attributes.background: Taxpayers are still footing Tony Blairs huge police protection bill. In some cases 12 Metropolitan Officers are involved at a cost to the tax payer of upto £16,000.00 per week.  This equates to an enormous amount of money over the past 6 years.
attributes.additional_details: His firm, Tony Blair Associates has made vast amounts of money over the past 6 years, and both his private and commercial work has taken him all over the world with round the clock protection, to which he should at least make a substantial contribution.

attributes.action: Make cat owners responsible for their cats fouling on private property
attributes.background: Cat fouling on private property is not treated with the same seriousness as dogs. There has been a huge cultural shift with personal ownership of dog fouling and feel this should now be extended to cats
attributes.additional_details:
Cat fouling on private property is frowned upon, but perfectly legal in the UK, whereas dogs, for example, if caught fouling in public places, would have their owner fined, if caught. Cats are allowed to foul wherever they please, while dog's excrement must be picked up and put in special bins, or cleaned if the dog did not even belong to you. Cat poo has toxins in it, and in some cases is as dangerous as dog poo. There are obvious health risks associated with this, especially to young children.
This petition stands for fines to be placed on a cat's owner if there is evidence (photographic or video) that the cat had fouled on the property. Should there be a call for cats to be kept on leads?

attributes.action: Start issuing on the spot fines for foreign drivers breaking UK driving laws
attributes.background: Foreign truck drivers speeding, overtaking in the third lane of the motorway and parking on hard shoulders and clearways
attributes.additional_details: A system should be employed whereby offending drivers are stopped at the point of exiting the UK, using the numerous cameras that already exist in the UK, and fined for offences committed on our roads

attributes.action: To apply CCTV in to the family courts.
attributes.background: To end the corruption in family courts, proceedings should be recorded. These recordings could be passed onto the police to enable them to investigate if allegations of lying under oath are made.
attributes.additional_details: By adding CCTV to prevent social workers, judges and parents from lying or turn them away from the idea of lying under oath.

attributes.action: Discuss a possible free trade area with the rest of the Commonwealth of Nations.
attributes.background:
We, the British people, will vote on the 23rd of June whether we leave the EU or remain.
In order to silence fear-mongering, we need a plan.
How about the Commonwealth of Nations, our friends that we turned our backs on 41 years ago in favour of signing up, unknowingly, for an EU straightjacket.
attributes.additional_details:
A free trade area between the 53 states of the Commonwealth of Nations would be within the interests of the British economy.
13 of these countries are among the fastest growing in the world.
“The Commonwealth is the ideal platform for business and trade… I hope that India’s ties with the Commonwealth will move from strength to strength, and that the new paradigm will only mean greater warmth, greater co-operation.” Kamal Nath, Former Indian Development Minister
The Commonwealth is the future.

attributes.action: Cancel the court closures announced on 11th February, 2016 and improve justice.
attributes.background: There are currently 460 courts and tribunals in E & W.  The govt. announced the closure of 86 of these, claiming they are substantially under used. Why not ensure that they are used more often - speeding up justice. It claims that they will be within a 1 hour car journey, ignores public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Govt. claims that the 86 courts are under used by 60%. This could be addressed by ensuring that matters are listed more quickly and the courts used more effectively. The Govt. claims that 97% of citizens will still be able to reach a court, by car, within an hour, ignoring those without cars. There are examples of round trips that will be costly and exceed four hours. This will stop justice being local and accessible.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate the matter of forcing schools to convert to academies
attributes.background: We were told Academy schools gave parents a choice from the mainstream, local authority system. Forcing all schools to become academies will deprive parents of ANY choice. This proposal was not in the Conservative manifesto in 2015, thus the government should not commit schools to this change.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no evidence that a universal academy system will work. Ofsted's Chief Inspector Sir Michael Wilshaw highlighted serious weaknesses at seven multi-academy trusts. He was also scathing about the level of pay given to the senior management in academies, with one head teacher earning £225,000 a year, more than the prime minister earns. Ref: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-35775458

If the Conservatives want to commit the education of our children to Academies then there should be a national debate and a referendum to make such an enormous change.

attributes.action: Bring England in line with the rest of the UK & make Prescriptions Free for all.
attributes.background: These costs apply only to England as prescription charges have been abolished in the rest of the UK. In Wales, prescriptions have been free for everyone since 2007, Northern Ireland scrapped the charges in 2010 and Scotland followed suit in 2011, Workers in England feel they are being Penalised.

attributes.action: Debate restrictions on the sale of button batteries.
attributes.background: Button batteries are an under recognised and unregulated risk to children. They look like sweets and are sold without restriction or appropriate packaging on the high street.  When swallowed they often get stuck in the throat cause severe burns with life threatening complications.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.rospa.com/home-safety/advice/product/button-cell-batteries/

http://www.afpp.org.uk/filegrab/1psa-button-batteries.pdf?ref=1923

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/campaigns/give-to-gosh/great-ormond-street-hospital-surgeon-warns-of-the-dangers-of-button-batteries-a6783641.html

attributes.action: Increased support and help for early development eating disorders.
attributes.background: Many people in the early stages of eating disorders are left for it to get worse before they can get treatment. It should be dealt with then so that the recovery process will be faster.

attributes.action: Raise the age children have to claim adult pip from 16 to 18
attributes.background: The law states that people are legally adult at 18, however children aged 16 have to claim adult disability benefits instead of childrens, despite not legally classed as an adult. I want the age of which an adult claim are made for PIP to be raised to 18, when you are legally classed as an adult
attributes.additional_details: Help allow 16 and 17 years olds get the help they need financially when disabled, instead of being penalised under an adult claim.

attributes.action: Remove all religious representatives from any Parliamentary institution.
attributes.background: Our Government should be 100% secular and should have no religious bias from any religious group. This means removing The Lords Spiritual from the House of Lords and removing any religious ceremony or act from any part of Parliamentary processes.
attributes.additional_details: The lack of secularism in our society promotes inequality through the definition of people and organisations by their affiliation to religious institutions. To combat inequality, our Political Leaders must be independent of all religious influence, irrespective of the religion, so that all decisions can be made in a fair and balanced way. This independence cannot be accomplished whilst we have members of one religious institution in Parliament in any form.

attributes.action: Major planning proposals/applications part of conveyancing searches.
attributes.background: To ensure any major planning proposals/applications show up in searches carried out by solicitors in conveyancing matters, enabling potential buyers to be aware of how their home/land/business may be affected in the future.
attributes.additional_details: The people of Gravesham and Thurrock have recently entered into the first consultation phase of a major new roadworks connecting Kent to Essex.  The consultation phase is short, therefore not giving residents opposed to the new infrastructure time to get opposing arguments together.  Thurrock is already one the most polluted boroughs in the UK.  Some residents have already been pre-warned their properties/land may be subject to CPOs and others will be left looking at 'spaghetti junction'.

attributes.action: A curriculum for the future. Give the youth a voice with in the education system
attributes.background:
We want a compulsory PHSE, that includes the following subjects :
•	Political, economics and current affairs. 
•	Wellbeing- basic life skills, mental health
•	Community cohesion & Cultural awareness-Justice, equality, discrimination
•	Finance, employment and enterprise
•	Social responsibility
attributes.additional_details:
Consultation with in schools and youth clubs in Manchester.
UKYP, National make your mark consultation- Curriculum for life coming in top 5 for 3 consecutive times.

attributes.action: Children at a school nursery should get a reception class place at that school
attributes.background: not all children attending a school nursery meet criteria to get allocated a place within the reception class. I want to make a change and make it a criteria that if a child attendeds a school nursery they are offered a place within the reception class of that school.
attributes.additional_details: In the first year of attending nursery children become accustomed to the rules and routines of there new school, They get used to there surroundings and make lots of new friends. To then not get a place within the school along with all of there friends could set them back in terms of the confidence social skills and there education.

attributes.action: Rules on assisted living need to be based on need not age
attributes.background: My father is heavily disabled and has been turned down by an assisted living organisation because he isn't 60, there are far more abled people within this home, this needs to be based on the need of the person not the age of the person. Assessment of the care required vs age restriction is a must

attributes.action: Include Fathers on Antenatal and Postnatal Mental Health NICE guidelines [CG192
attributes.background: Mark says “I’ve spoken to fathers with bipolar, schizophrenia, clinical depression, anxiety and other mental health illness who have no support plan in place at this crucial time. Fathers Suffer from Anxiety, Postnatal Depression and Trauma at childbirth too. Research says 1 in 10 fathers are (PND)
attributes.additional_details:
Clair Rees 1001 Critical Days Blog http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/clair-rees/fatherhood-a-generational-shift_b_10564612.html
Fathers Institute Perinatal Mental Health : http://www.fatherhoodinstitute.org/2010/fatherhood-institute-research-summary-fathers-and-postnatal-depression/
 Fathers and Childbirth Trauma:http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/why-the-trauma-of-childbirth-on-fathers-is-no-joke-8572222.html

attributes.action: Make Southern Rail give automatic refunds to all customers affected by delays.
attributes.background: For months now, those of us who travel on Southern have been blighted by delays due to 'staff sickness' which has since morphed into 'a shortage of train crew'. Annual ticket holders get no compensation and it is not simple for others to claim, so Southern continue to profit on poor performance.
attributes.additional_details:
Southern services continue to be severely affected by train crew availability including a high level of conductor sickness, which is leading to some services being cancelled for part or all of their journey.
Planned industrial action affecting Southern services on Tuesday 21 June
A list of the services which have been pre-cancelled is available here.

http://www.southernrailway.com/your-journey/plan-your-journey/live-running-information/incidents/#iAD816EDFC4114A84A299ABF7D41FE43F

attributes.action: Make audio-visual announcements be included in the government's new 'Buses Bill'
attributes.background: If the government are reviewing the overall regulation of the industry then it would be a suitable time to ensure that bus networks are fully accessible. Audio-visual technology speaks and displays next and final stop information, assisting those visually impaired to use the bus with confidence.
attributes.additional_details:
I am petitioning as I would like to see the government's new bill include a requirement for ‘Talking Buses’. These are buses which include on board audio-visual (A/V) next stop and final destination announcements, as well as other important information regarding the service. This vital assistive technology enables people who are blind or visually impaired to get the bus independently and with confidence.

This technology is a rarity outside London, and that needs to change!

attributes.action: Make local councils responsible for the law on cannabis in their area.
attributes.background: The government has decided that a nationwide legalisation of cannabis is not on the cards, so perhaps a council by council ruling (bylaws) could be an alternative. A more democratic way that would allow the trialling of a regulated market in small areas first.
attributes.additional_details: A similar model has worked exceptionally well in the US, so why not learn from their successes and follow suit? Let the people decide what's right for them.

attributes.action: Amend guidelines: Smear tests for all sexually active females across UK.
attributes.background:
Women under 25 in Britain (excluding Scotland) are subjected to guidelines which limited their ability to receive smear tests at first request despite showing symptoms

A petition on this issue in 2015 reached over 300,000 signature, but those we elected to voice our opinions denied our request.
attributes.additional_details:
You can read the governments response to the petition of 2015 here: https://petition.parliament.uk/archived/petitions/62385

We may only account for 2% of 2011's cervical cancer diagnosis, but our health matter just as much as those 25+ females. 

We should not have to fight for our right to tests which can save women. We should aid in the prevention of invasive cervical cancer before our sisters & friends have to make the decision between a Hysterectomy or a Cone Biopsy.

attributes.action: Encourage companies to provide home based jobs for the disabled/chronically ill.
attributes.background: I want more large UK companies to provide home based job roles so the disabled/chronically ill have more opportunities available to them. Many disabled/chronically ill people hate not being able to work and want to contribute, but find it hard to find a well paid job to suit their ability.
attributes.additional_details: I am a sufferer of Ulcerative Colitis, a chronic illness and form of Inflammatory Bowel Disease. I recently had to step down from my managerial role due to my illness. I  looked for a legitimate UK home based job without success. I was only able to find US based work at home jobs. I want this for the UK.

attributes.action: Make learning about FGM part of the curriculum
attributes.background: FGM happens from birth to adolescent it happens all over the world . Even thought It's illegal in the uk it's still practised. Raising awareness of FGM will help people understand the issues it makes girls everywhere face and enable people to comprehend that it's a violation of human rights.

attributes.action: Protect public libraries with ring-fenced budgets devolved to local authorities.
attributes.background: Since 2010, Government cuts to council budgets have resulted in huge cuts to public services.  Public libraries across England have been hit hard with libraries closing, opening hours slashed and qualified librarians being replaced with volunteers .  Libraries are not a luxury, they are a necessity.
